intro: Medinilla tsinjoarivensis, commonly known as the Madagascar velvet tangerine, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its attractive, velvety leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its flowers are clustered in inflorescences and are often visited by pollinators such as bees and birds. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
